title: MI New York Vs Texas Super Kings Eliminator Live Streaming, MLC 2024: When And Where To Watch On TV And Online
body:
MI New York will go face-to-face against Texas Super Kings in the Eliminator of the ongoing 2024 Major League Cricket on Thursday, July 25, at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas. (More Cricket News)

The Texas Super Kings will walk into the Eliminator, finishing third on the points table and will play their last league game against Seattle Orcas.

On the other hand, the MI New York finished fourth on the points table with equal points after superior net run rate to Los Angeles Knight Riders, winning two from seven.

Here are the live streaming details of the MI New York vs Texas Super Kings, Major League Cricket 2024 Eliminator:

The MI New York vs Texas Super Kings, Major League Cricket 2024 Eliminator will be played on Thursday, July 25 at 6 AM as per Indian time at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas.

In India, the MI New York vs Texas Super Kings Eliminator match can be watched on the Sony Sports Ten 1 SD & HD TV channels. Live streaming of the match will be available on the Jio Cinema app and website in India.

title: Washington Freedom Vs San Francisco Unicorns Qualifier Live Streaming, MLC 2024: When And Where To Watch On TV And Online
body:
The Major League Cricket 2024 has reached its business end as the final four teams remain in contention. In the Eliminator, Texas Super Kings take on MI New York whereas the Qualifier sees Washington Freedom locking horns against San Francisco Unicorns. (More Cricket News)

The winner of the Qualifier and the Challenger will fight for the trophy in the final clash.

Qualifier: Washington Freedom vs San Francisco Unicorns - July 26 at 6 AM IST at the Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas.

The Qualifier will be played on July 26, Thursday, at 6:00 AM IST at Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas. These two last met in match 20 of the MLC 2024 with SFU coming out trumps with a 6-wicket win (DLS).

Washington Freedom vs San Francisco Unicorns, Major League Cricket 2024 Qualifier will be played on July 26, Thursday at 6:00 AM IST at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas.

In India, the MLC 2024 will be telecast LIVE on the Sony Sports Ten 1 SD & HD TV channels. Live streaming of the match will be available on the Jio Cinema app and website in India.

title: MLC 2024 Live Streaming in India: Watch Texas Super Kings vs Seattle Orcas Online and Live Telecast of Major League Cricket T20 Cricket Match
body:
Settle Orcas registered a sole win in the MLC (Major League Cricket) 2024 over the LA Knight Riders in game six of the tournament and lost four games in a row. Playing in their final group stage match, Seattle Orcas will be looking to finish high after losing a playoff-berth. The Texas Super Kings vs Seattle Orcas match will be played at the Grand Prairie Cricket Stadium and it starts at 6:00 AM IST (Indian Standard Time) on July 24. Sony Sports Network is the official broadcast partner of MLC 2024 in India and the Texas Super Kings vs Seattle Orcas match live telecast will be available on Sony Sports Ten TV channels. Fans in India looking for an online viewing option of Texas Super Kings vs Seattle Orcas can find it on the JioCinema app and website. title: Cognizant Major League Cricket 2024 - Texas Super Kings beat Seattle Orcas by 37 runs in final league match
body:
Calvin Savage's all-round performance took the Texas Super Kings to a comprehensive 37-run win over Seattle Orcas in the final league match of the Cognizant Major League Cricket 2024 at Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas

Match Summary

Texas Super Kings vs Seattle Orcas, Match 21

Texas Super Kings 177/8 (20 ov)

Seattle Orcas 140/9 (20 ov)

Texas Super Kings won by 37 runs.

title: MLC 2024 Playoffs: Teams, Matches, Venues, Timings In IST — All You Need To Know
body:
MLC 2024 Playoffs: Major League Cricket (MLC) season 2024 has almost come to its knockout stage as the final four teams are already decided with one group-stage match still to go. However, the result of that match will have no impact on the top four teams and the knockout scenario of the tournament. San Francisco Unicorns (SFU) defeated Washington Freedom (WAF) by six wickets (DLS) in a rain-marred match on July 23 (as per the Indian Standard Time).

Washington Freedom, San Francisco Unicorns, Texas Super Kings (TSK) and MI New York (MINY) are the top four teams that will feature in the MLC 2024 knockouts. TSK will take on MINY in the Eliminator and the winner will then play against the loser of the Qualifier, which will feature WAF and SFU, in the Challenger. Then the winner of the Qualifier and the Challenger will fight for the trophy in the final clash.

ALSO ON ABP Live | The Hundred Men’s Competition 2024: Full Schedule, Teams, Venues, Timings In IST — All You Need To Know

MLC 2024 Playoffs- Teams, Dates & Timings In IST (Indian Standard Time)

Eliminator: Texas Super Kings vs MI New York - July 25 at 6 AM IST at the Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas

Qualifier: Washington Freedom vs San Francisco Unicorns - July 26 at 6 AM IST at the Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas

Challenger: Winner of Eliminator vs Loser of Qualifier - July 27 at 6 AM IST at the Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas

Final: Winner of Qualifier vs Winner of Challenger - July 29 at 6 AM IST at the Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas

San Francisco Outplay Washington In Rain-Marred Group Stage Match

In the match, WAF captain Steve Smith won the toss and opted to bat first. Along with Travis Head, Smith took Washington off to a flying start. WAF were at the score of 70 runs without the loss of any wicket in just six overs. Despite the wickets of Steve Smith and Travis Head later into the innings, WAF maintained the quick scoring rate and were 174-3 in 15.3 overs when the rain came.

A big rain-break caused the match to be cut short to just 14 overs a side and SFU were tasked with the target of 177 runs in 14 overs. Despite the daunting target, SFU chased it with two balls remaining, with Sanjay Krishnamurthi scoring a brilliant 79 runs knock off just 42 balls and Josh Inglis scoring a 17-ball 45 runs.

title: Major League Cricket: Texas Super Kings End League Stage with 37-run Win over Seattle Orcas
body:
Dallas [Texas], July 24 (ANI): Led by Calvin Savage's all-round performance, the Texas Super Kings handed the Seattle Orcas a comprehensive 37-run defeat in the final league match of the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 at Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas, on Tuesday.

Despite Quinton de Kock and Shehan Jayasuriya giving the Orcas a solid start in their run chase the Texas Super Kings' bowlers, led by Ottneil Bartmann (3/20), Noor Ahmad (2/19) and Calvin Savage (2/23), dismantled the Seattle batting lineup.

Also Read | Paris Olympic Games 2024: Top British Olympian Charlotte Dujardin Withdraws Over ‘Error of Judgement’.

With the conclusion of the match, Seattle Orcas finish their campaign with six losses and a sole victory, whereas the Texas Super Kings, who secured three wins and two losses (two no results) will play MI New York in the eliminator.

Mirroring the first innings, the Seattle Orcas' run chase of 178 runs, lost Ryan Rickleton (0) off the first ball of the innings to Ottneil Bartman. Shehan Jayasuriya (24 in 27 balls, with three fours and a six) joined Quinton de Kock (26 in 19 balls, with two fours and a six), and the pair took control of the run chase. At the end of the powerplay, the Seattle Orcas were placed at 47/1.

Also Read | Will Lamine Yamal Play Tonight in Uzbekistan vs Spain Paris Olympics 2024 Match? Here's the Possibility of Barcelona Star Featuring in Starting XI.

Shehan Jayasuriya eventually fell to Calvin Savage in the seventh over after a 27-ball stint at the crease. Not long after, the dangerous Quinton de Kock was also dismissed, leaving the Orcas at 59/3 in the ninth over.

Faced with a steep equation, the onus was on Heinrich Klaasen (4) and Matthew Bracewell (4) to steer the innings. However, both batters were outfoxed by spinners and dismissed for single digits. Mitchell Santner saw the back of Klaasen, while Bracewell was trapped by Noor Ahmad.

Coming together with the score at 67/5 in 10.4 overs, Shubham Ranjane (16) and Keemo Paul (25 in 17 balls, with three fours) labored to keep the Orcas in contention. However, Ranjane was run out and Keemo Paul was castled by Noor Ahmad before the 17th over, comprehensively extinguishing the run chase. Ali Sheikh chipped in with a consolatory knock, but the Orcas fell well short, finishing at 140/9.Otneill Bartman took two wickets in the tail to finish with figures of 3/20.

Earlier in the day. The Texas Super Kings lost openers Devon Conway (0) and Joshua Tromp (6) early in the innings, however, Faf Du Plessis (39 in 17 balls) was in fine form, smashing six boundaries and a six before he was scalped by Keemo Paul. At the end of the power play the Texas Super Kings were placed at 56/3.

Milind Kumar (29 in 28 balls, with two sixes) played a watchful knock, scoring nearly a run-a-ball before he became Keemo Paul's second wicket of the day. The experienced all-rounders, Marcus Stoinis (11) and Mitchell Santner (15) both got starts, but failed to convert them into bigger scores, falling to Aryan Desai and Matthew Bracewell, respectively.

Calvin Savage (45* in 27 balls, with six fours and two sixes) orchestrated the biggest partnership of the innings, joined by Cameron Stevenson, the pair put on 43 runs in just 23 deliveries in the final phase of the innings. Stevenson (17) struck a four and six to support Savage's late innings fireworks, but was cleaned by Nandre Burger in the 18th overs.

Savage hammered Bracewell for two consecutive maximums in the 16th over and went on to script a 17 run over of Nande Burger's 18th over to remain unbeaten and help the Texas Super Kings finish at 177/8.

Brief Scores

Texas Super Kings 177/8 (Faf Du Plessis 39 off 17, Colin Savage 45* off 27, Keemo Paul 2/18, Ayan Desai 2/30) beat Seattle Orcas 140/9 (Quinton de Kock 26 off 19, Keemo Paul 25 off 17, Ottneil Bartman 3/20, Noor Ahmad 2/19 ) by 37 runs. (ANI)

title: Major League Cricket 2024 - Eliminator - TSK vs MINY - Cricket Betting Tips and Match Predictions: July 24th
body:
Here are the Fantasy Cricket Predictions and Betting Tips for the Major League Cricket Match 22 (Eliminator) -Texas Super Kings vs MI New York, which will be played on the 24th of July at the Grand Prairie Stadium, Texas.

Points Table

Match 22 - Eliminator- Texas Super Kings vs MI New York (Grand Prairie Stadium, Texas)

Current Form Texas Super Kings:

Texas Super Kings finished at the 3rd position on points table after league stages and they will now face MI New York in the Eliminator match.

The top run scorer for Texas Super Kings in the Major League Cricket is Faf du Plessis with 303 runs to his name.

The top wicket taker for Texas Super Kings in the Major League Cricket is Marcus Stoinis with 6 scalps under his belt.

Texas Super Kings have won their previous match against Seattle Orcas by 37 runs.

Texas Super Kings batted first and they posted a total of 177 for 8 in 20 overs. Devon Conway and Joshua Tromp got out cheaply. Faf du Plessis once again led from the front and smashed 39 runs in 17 balls at the top of the order. The middle order struggled and they were 6 wickets down for 113 at one stage. This is when Calvin Savage played a memorable knock of 45 runs in 27 balls to help Texas Super Kings get past the 170 run mark and finish at 177 in 20 overs of play.

During the chase, Seattle Orcas lost their in form batter Ryan Rickelton cheaply. After his dismissal, Quinton de Kock and Shehan Jayasuriya staged a fightback but their partnership didn't show any real momentum and it cost their team dearly. After these two got out, the middle order simply surrendered to the quality bowling display by TSK bowlers. Ottniel Baartman picked up 3 wickets for 20 runs as Seattle Orcas were restricted to 140 for 9 in 20 overs, losing the match by 37 runs.

Batting Stats T20

Current Form MI New York:

MI New York finished at the 4th position on points table after league stages and they will now face Texas Super Kings in the Eliminator match.

The top run scorer for MI New York in the Major League Cricket is Nicholas Pooran with 172 runs to his name.

The top wicket taker for MI New York in the Major League Cricket is Rashid Khan with 10 scalps under his belt.

MI New York have won their previous match against LA Knight Riders by 4 wickets.

LA Knight Riders batted first and they posted a total of 130 before being bowled out. Jason Roy scored 27 runs at the top of the order. The rest of the top order batters simply failed to get going and kept throwing their wicket away. Andre Russell played well and smashed 35 runs in 21 balls but it didn't make much difference to the scorecard as LA Knight Riders were eventually bowled out for 130. For MI New York, Rashid Khan picked up 3 wickets for just 22 runs.

During the chase, MI New York lost Ruben Clinton quite cheaply. After his dismissal, Dewald Brevis and Nicholas Pooran took the same of taking MI New York over the line. They smashed 27 and 35 runs respectively to almost seal the deal in favor of MI New York. In the lower order, Kieron Pollard played a nice cameo of 33 runs in 12 balls to win the match for MI New York with 4 wickets in hand.

Wicket Takers T20

Let’s have a look at the squads:

MI New York

Nicholas Pooran, Shayan Jahangir, Nosthusha Kenjige, Dewald Brevis, Rushil Ugarkar, Ruben Clinton, Anrich Nortje, Monank Patel, Steven Taylor, Romario Shepherd, Trent Boult, Ehsan Adil, Tim David, Heath Richards, Kagiso Rabada, Rashid Khan, Kieron Pollard

Texas Super Kings

Rusty Theron, Saiteja Mukkamalla, Imran Tahir, Calvin Savage, Faf du Plessis, Marcus Stoinis, Gerald Coetzee, Devon Conway, Milind Kumar, Zia Shahzad, Mohammad Mohsin, Matthew Tromp, Naveen-ul-Haq, Dwayne Bravo, Daniel Sams, Cody Chetty, Noor Ahmad,Sami Aslam, Mitchell Santner, Zia ul-Haq, Lahiru Milantha, Cameron Stevenson

Most 6's T20

title: The Hundred 2024 news: Schutt joins Oval Invincibles
body:
19h ago

Green, Little provide MLC cover

Chris Green has signed for Trent Rockets as short-term cover while Rashid Khan is at Major League Cricket. Josh Little will also replace Haris Rauf at Welsh Fire for their opening match, with Haris Rauf also at MLC.

title: Texas Super Kings vs Seattle Orcas highlights: Texas Super Kings beat Seattle Orcas by 37 runs
body:
Right then, that's it from this final group stage game, where the Texas Super Kings secured two more points and will head into the playoffs of this second season of Major League Cricket. The excitement continues with the first knockout game, the Eliminator, scheduled for Thursday, July 25th. In this high-stakes match, the Texas Super Kings will face off against MI New York for a coveted spot in the Qualifier. The first ball is set to be bowled at 6 am IST (12.30 am GMT), but be sure to tune in earlier for all the pre-match buildup. Until then, cheers and goodbye!

Faf du Plessis, the skipper of the Texas Super Kings says it was important for a few guys to get time in the middle and they decided to change the batting order a bit to make sure they head into the crucial stage with good momentum. Further adds that they focused on getting the small things right heading into the big Eliminator in a day's time.

Heinrich Klaasen, the skipper of Seattle Orcas says it has been a tough and difficult season for them. Adds that with a few guys being injured, it is quite difficult to find the concrete 11. Informs that the bowling group has been fantastic, but the batting group were the ones who could not make it count. Adds that it is very tough to find the rhythm of the game in just seven matches. States that they can make some investments in a couple of players. Concludes that it is not doom and gloom for the franchise and hopes to reset and re-focus for the next season.

Calvin Savage is the PLAYER OF THE MATCH for his outstanding all-round performance. He says it was good fun after having put in so much hard work it felt very good. Adds that he tried to keep things simple in the middle and stay positive and it paid well for him with the bat. Further says he tries to vary the pace and keep it tight using long boundaries to his advantage. Concludes that he will try to keep things the same going ahead.

Earlier in the game, Ayan Desai gave the Seattle Orcas a perfect start by dismissing Devon Conway on the very first ball of the innings. Cameron Gannon then joined the fray, taking another wicket in his first over. Despite these early setbacks, Faf du Plessis kept his intentions clear and continued to score from one end for TSK, but he lost his wicket just before the end of the powerplay. The Texas Super Kings kept losing wickets in the middle around Milind Kumar who looked steady in his outing but couldn't carry on after getting himself off to a good start. TSK however managed to get back on track in the final few overs, thanks to a blistering onslaught from Calvin Savage, who remained unbeaten with 45 off just 27 balls. He received valuable support from Cameron Stevenson, helping TSK reach a competitive total of 177 runs. For the Seattle Orcas, Keemo Paul and Ayan Desai had standout performances, each claiming two wickets.

Ottneil Baartman stood out with impressive figures of 3 for 20 for the Texas Super Kings. Alongside him, the other bowlers chipped in to ensure the job was done. Noor Ahmad was a mystery for the Orcas batters, ending with a couple of wickets, while Calvin Savage also claimed two wickets. Despite a few missed chances in the field, the Texas Super Kings will be mighty pleased with their efforts, particularly their comeback with the bat. They will now carry this momentum into the all-important eliminator.

Heinrich Klaasen, on whom the game was resting, once again failed to make his presence felt, extending his dry run with another low score and putting the Orcas in an even deeper hole. The Texas Super Kings' spinners compounded the Orcas' struggles, making run-scoring increasingly difficult. Shubham Ranjane and Keemo Paul fought back with a 39-run partnership, attempting to take on a few bowlers in the middle overs. However, with the asking rate soaring, it became an insurmountable task, resulting in another defeat for the Orcas. This marked their sixth loss in seven games, ending the tournament on a forgettable note.

Ottneil Baartman gave the Super Kings a perfect start by claiming the wicket of Ryan Rickelton on the very first ball of the innings. Despite a gritty partnership between Quinton de Kock and Shehan Jayasuriya, the bowlers kept things tight, building pressure on the batters. This pressure led to the fall of a couple more wickets before the halfway mark, further complicating the chase for the Seattle Orcas.

W

Overs18.5

Score132 - 9

Ottneil Baartman to Ali Sheikh, OUT! CAUGHT! Another one bites the dust. Ottneil Baartman entices the batter with the short one and he falls for it. Ali Sheikh swivels on his back foot and pulls it to deep square leg. The ball is hit flat and hard, but straight down the throat of Marcus Stoinis who makes no mistake this time either.

W

Overs18.3

Score131 - 8

Ottneil Baartman to Cameron Gannon, OUT! CAUGHT! Marcus Stoinis takes a stunning catch near the ropes. It is too full, wide outside off. Cameron Gannon throws his blade at it and ends up slicing it to the left of deep backward point. Marcus Stoinis moves to his left and pouches it safely.

W

Overs16.4

Score110 - 7

Ottneil Baartman to Shubham Ranjane, OUT! RUN OUT! A huge mix-up and Shubham Ranjane is a goner. It is a slower bumper, outside off. Shubham Ranjane miscues it towards mid on and ventures out looking for a single, but is caught in two minds here. Joshua Tromp charges in and throws it to the bowler, who gathers it and takes the bails off quickly at the non-striker's end.

Strategic break! With 77 runs needed off the last 5 overs, the Seattle Orcas will need a few explosive overs right after this break to put pressure back on the opposition. These two batters have the capability to turn the game around but will need to focus on taking the game deep to maximize their chance. While for Texas Super Kings, a couple more wickets will probably put them closer to the winning line.

title: MLC: San Francisco Unicorns Confirm Top-2 Spot, Eliminate Seattle Orcas With 6-wicket Win
body:
San Francisco Unicorns: An impressive spell by Hassan Khan and a quick-fire half-century by Finn Allen helped the San Francisco Unicorns to register a six-wicket win over the Seattle Orcas in the Major League Cricket at the Grand Prairie Stadium.

After losing their openers in the first over, Quinton de Kock anchored the innings with 62 off 33 balls, helping the Seattle Orcas post a total of 152/7. However, Finn Allen's explosive 77 off 30 balls took the San Francisco Unicorns to a comfortable six-wicket win.

With this victory, the San Francisco Unicorns remain in second place on the points table with nine points from six matches, while the Seattle Orcas have been officially eliminated from the second season of Major League Cricket.

Trending

Already qualified for the playoffs, the San Francisco Unicorns began their run chase of 153 runs at a blistering pace. They smashed 79 runs in the powerplay, thanks to Allen's 21-ball fifty. He struck 26 runs in the fifth over, bowled by Lungi Ngidi, which featured two sixes and three fours.

Matthew Short, on the other hand, was dismissed by Imad Wasim in the seventh over after scoring 19 off 14 balls. Allen continued in the same vein, hitting two sixes off Harmeet Singh before being caught by Ryan Rickelton on the fifth ball of the eighth over. He scored 77 off 30 balls, leaving San Francisco at 98/2 after eight overs.

Unicorns then lost two more wickets in consecutive overs. Sanjay Krishnamurthi was dismissed for 10 off 16 balls in the 13th over, followed by Sherfane Rutherford in the 14th, who scored 17 off 8 balls. However, Josh Inglis and Corey Anderson guided San Francisco to a comfortable six-wicket win with 34 balls to spare.

In a must-win game, the Seattle Orcas faced a disastrous start after being invited to bat first. They lost both openers in the very first over: Ryan Rickelton was caught by Finn Allen on the first ball, and Aaron Jones was trapped lbw by Carmi le Roux.

Despite an early setback, Seattle managed to score 48 runs in the powerplay, thanks to an aggressive counter-attack by Quinton de Kock and Shehan Jayasuriya. They added 34 runs in the last two overs of the powerplay, bringing the score to 48/2.

De Kock reached his half-century off 28 balls by the 10th over. Alongside Jayasuriya, he added 31 runs off Pat Cummins' first two overs, pushing Seattle to 98/2 after 11 overs. However, the momentum shifted dramatically in the 12th over as both De Kock (62 off 33) and Jayasuriya (31 off 33) were dismissed in quick succession by Brody Couch.

Hassan Khan then delivered a decisive blow to Seattle Orcas, as he struck thrice in his two consecutive overs. He dismissed Heinrich Klaasen (8 off 8) in the 14th over, and Harmeet Singh (3 off 7) and Keemo Paul (0 off 1) in the 16th over, reducing Seattle to 116/7.

De Kock reached his half-century off 28 balls by the 10th over. Alongside Jayasuriya, he added 31 runs off Pat Cummins' first two overs, pushing Seattle to 98/2 after 11 overs. However, the momentum shifted dramatically in the 12th over as both De Kock (62 off 33) and Jayasuriya (31 off 33) were dismissed in quick succession by Brody Couch.

Also Read: Akram ‘hopes’ Indian Team Will Travel To Pakistan For Champions Trophy

Brief scores: San Francisco Unicorns 156/4 in 14.2 overs (Finn Allen 77 off 30, Josh Inglis 24 off 17; Harmeet Singh 2-39) beat Seattle Orcas 152/7 in 20 overs (Quinton de Kock 62 off 33, Shehan Jayasuriya 31 off 33; Hassan Khan 3-5) by six wickets.

Advertisement

Cricket Scorecard

title: Pakistan-born Hassan Khan shines as Unicorns secure Qualifier spot in MLC 2024
body:
Pakistan-born Hassan Khan delivered a match-winning cameo for the San Francisco Unicorns, securing their place in the Qualifier match of the ongoing Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024.

Washington Freedom, after being asked to bat first, managed to score 174 runs for the loss of three wickets in 15.3 overs, thanks to the consistent drizzle. Opening batters Travis Head and skipper Steve Smith each scored 56 runs, forming a formidable 100-run opening stand.

On the bowling front, Pakistan pacer Haris Rauf struggled, conceding 20 runs in his two-over spell without taking a wicket. Corey Anderson, however, picked up two crucial wickets.

The Unicorns were set a revised target of 177 runs in 14 overs under the DLS method.

Their chase began on a rocky note, with opener Finn Allen falling to Akeal Hosein on the very first ball. Despite this early setback, Sanjay Krishnamurthi (79*) and Josh Inglis (45) kept the innings afloat with aggressive knocks.

The spotlight, however, was on Hassan Khan, who played a brilliant match-winning cameo of 32 runs off just 11 balls, including four boundaries and two sixes.

His late flourish ensured that the Unicorns chased down the target, losing four wickets in just 13.4 overs.

This victory propels the San Francisco Unicorns to the next round of the tournament, where they will once again face Washington Freedom in the Qualifier match scheduled for July 25th.

title: MLC 2024 Playoffs Format Explained: Schedule, Date, Time in IST and Venues Confirmed Details
body:
The United States of America (USA)’s T20 league, the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 season got off to a boosted start after the country great performance in their debut edition of the T20 World Cup where they reached the Super Eight stage of the competition jointly hosted by West Indies and USA. As a result, USA have also qualified for the T20 World Cup 2026 to be played in India.

Meanwhile, after giving us some enthralling cricket action, the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 season is nearing its climax, with the four teams advancing to the knockout stage already confirmed, even though one group-stage match remains as of writing this between the Texas Super Kings and Seattle Orcas. This upcoming match will not influence the standings or the knockout phase though.

Find Best Betting Tips and Predictions for Major League Cricket 2024 Here

The teams advancing to the MLC 2024 knockouts are Washington Freedom (WSF), San Francisco Unicorns (SFU), Texas Super Kings (TSK), and MI New York (MINY), as all the teams finished in top four in the MLC 2024 points table. Now many might wonder how does the Major League Cricket (MLC) playoffs format works. In this article, we take a look at the MLC 2024 Playoffs format.

The Major League Cricket format is very much similar to that of the most successful T20 league in the world, the Indian Premier League (IPL). Just IPL, there is Eliminator, there is Qualifier 1, however, the Qualifier 2 is called the Challenger, we will get to know more about it.

Eliminator in MLC 2024

Now in the IPL, the playoffs phase begins with the Qualifier 1 between the top 2 teams in the points table with the winner of the match directly going to the final. However, in this case, in the MLC, we will have the Eliminator first between the 3rd and 4th placed team. The winner of the match of will progress into the playoffs further while the loser is completely out of the competition, just like the Eliminator match in the IPL.

Qualifier in MLC 2024

Now, Major League Cricket’s Qualifier is equivalent of the Indian Premier League (IPL)’s Qualifier 1. The top 2 teams at the end of the league phase in the MLC 2024 points table will play in this match. And just the like IPL, the winner of this match will directly progress into the MLC 2024 Final while the losing team will have another opportunity.

Challenger in MLC 2024

In the Indian Premier League (IPL), in the Qualifier 2, the winner of the Eliminator and the loser of the Qualifier 1 plays. It is exactly the same format here as well where the Eliminator winning team will take on the losing team from the Qualifier match and in the end, the winning team will qualify for the Final against Qualifier winner. And rather than calling it qualifier, they call it Challenger as it identifies the challenger team for the Qualifier winner in the MLC 2024 Final.

ELIMINATOR: Texas Super Kings vs MI New York – 25th July, 6 A.M Indian Standard Time (IST), Grand Prairie Cricket Stadium

QUALIFIER: Washington Freedom vs San Francisco Unicorns – 26th July, 6 A.M Indian Standard Time (IST), Grand Prairie Cricket Stadium

CHALLENGER: Winner of Eliminator vs Loser of Qualifier – 27 July, 6 A.M Indian Standard Time (IST), Grand Prairie Cricket Stadium

We look at the players battles for Match 21 of Major League Cricket to be played between TEX vs SEA. We will also have the Texas Super Kings vs Seattle Orcas player records and player head to head records.

title: Texas Super Kings vs Seattle Orcas Prediction
body:
Texas Super Kings vs Seattle Orcas Match Prediction & Betting Tips - MLC 2024

Texas Super Kings will take on Seattle Orcas at the Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas in Match 21 of the 2024 Major League Cricket. This game gets underway at 20:30 local time on Tuesday 23rd July 2024.

TSK vs SOR, Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas Pitch Report

With over 350 runs scored on this pitch on Monday, we expect to see another batter-friendly surface with the ball carrying through at a good pace.

Read on for team previews, betting tips, latest odds, and match prediction for Texas Super Kings vs Seattle Orcas, Major League Cricket 2024

Texas Super Kings Team News & Playing 11

TSK Team News

Although Texas Super Kings were beaten by Washington Freedom by 42 runs to end an unbeaten run, they are still well placed in the group stage and are guaranteed to finish in third position. This will be their first head to head with Seattle Orcas this season.

TSK Team Batting

Chasing an unlikely 207 in Match 17 against Washington Freedom, South African captain and opener Faf du Plessis continued his strong form with another half-century. Devon Conway, Aaron Hardie and Marcus Stoinis, all in the top five, are all top level T20 batters.

TSK Team Bowling

Only Mohammad Mohsin and Noor Ahmed kept their economy rates to under 10.00 in the last match and the opening pair of Zia-ul-Haq and Marcus Stoinis will both want to be far tighter in this game. Dwayne Bravo’s experience with the ball will also be key on this strong batting wicket.

TSK Team Form

Texas Super Kings were unbeaten in four matches until their defeat to Washington Freedom on Friday.

Texas Super Kings Predicted Playing 11

Devon Conway (wk), Faf du Plessis (c), Aaron Hardie, Joshua Trump, Marcus Stoinis, Milind Kumar, Calvin Savage, Dwayne Bravo, Mohammad Mohsin, Noor Ahmad, Zia-ul-Haq

Seattle Orcas Team News & Playing 11

SOR Team News

It was another convincing defeat for Seattle Orcas on Saturday as they lost by six wickets with 34 balls remaining to San Francisco Unicorns. Irrespective of how this match goes, Seattle Orcas can not advance to the play-offs and will finish bottom of the table.

SOR Team Batting

As one of only four players to have hit 200+ runs in the tournament so far, Ryan Rickelton will be a key wicket at the top of the order for Seattle Orcas in this match. Keeper-batter Quinton de Kock and skipper Heinrich Klaasen have had disappointing tournaments but de Kock did hit a half-century in Seattle’s last game.

SOR Team Bowling

In spite of losing again, Seattle Orcas did put in a better bowling performance in their last game with only Michael Bracewell and Ali Sheikh going wicketless. Cameron Gannon has been their most consistent bowler across this year’s competition.

SOR Team Form

Seattle Orcas come into this fixture looking to avoid their fifth successive defeat.

Seattle Orcas Predicted Playing 11

Ryan Rickelton, Aaron Jones, Quinton de Kock (wk), Shehan Jayasuriya, Heinrich Klaasen, Michael Bracewell, Harmeet Singh, Keemo Paul, Cameron Gannon, Lungi Ngidi, Ali Sheikh
